metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6497 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
clamscan in ClamAV before 0.98.5, when using -a option, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (crash) as demonstrated by thejwplayer.js file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6497` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-base - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libclamav6 - 0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.98.5+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
